summary:
**Meeting Overview**: The City of Dallas Civil Service Board has announced the cancellation of its public meeting originally scheduled for March 5, 2024, at 9:30 a.m. The next meeting will take place via videoconference on April 2, 2024, at the 1C South Board Room, Dallas City Hall. The meeting aims to address civil service matters and engage with the public while adhering to pandemic-related health protocols.

**Key Agenda Items**: Although specific agenda items for the April meeting have yet to be posted, the board typically discusses civil service regulations, employee policies, and related administrative matters.

**Important Details**: The meeting will be conducted in compliance with the Texas Open Meetings Act, with the agenda to be made available at least 72 hours prior to the meeting. Public attendance is encouraged, both virtually and in person, with adherence to health guidelines.

**Action Items**: The board will seek public input and may make decisions regarding civil service policies, but specific approvals or proposals will be outlined in the forthcoming agenda. Attendees are reminded of the handgun prohibition on city property as per state law.
